snippet: After the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School, both parties in the state legislature agreed to find a gun solution together — but the process was fraught from the start.
abstract: Passage of stricter gun laws in Connecticut was fraught with contention and ferocious lobbying by pro- and anti-gun groups, despite seeming unity following Newtown massacre; legislation remained uncertain until last minute, as lawmakers compromised on wide range of issues, large and small.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and RAY RIVERA

lead_paragraph: After the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School, both parties in the state legislature agreed to find a gun solution together — but the process was fraught from the start.

headline.seo: Even in Shadow of Massacre, Connecticut’s Gun Law Faced Uphill Fight
headline.main:

headline.print_headline: In Connecticut, Gun Curbs Had Difficult Path
